instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01949: What is 820-01949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .
definitions.PP5V_S5_LDO: What is PP5V_S5_LDO? PP5V_S5_LDO is a 5v rail present when the machine is in a S5 soft off state. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3S: What is PP3V3_G3S? PP3V3_G3S is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in a G3S standby state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.041A
threads.message:
Liquid damage on <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>, <SIGNAL>J3300_CWR</SIGNAL>
Tested with board only.
No shorts on big coils.

When charger switch from 5V to 20V so first couple of seconds it takes 0.26A-0.31A and then drop to 0.041A and stays at 0.041A.


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.60V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.38V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5.15V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 0V - 0.335V in diode mode

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_PMU_VDDMAIN</SIGNAL> - 3.35V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_CPU</SIGNAL> - 12.58V
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0_PRIM1V8</SIGNAL> - 12.59V
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P5VG3S</SIGNAL> - 12.59V
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.60V
PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3HRTC - 12.59V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_SSD0</SIGNAL> - 12.58V

<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> - 5.13V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL> - 5.14V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> - 3.38V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD0</SIGNAL> - 3.30V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3S</SIGNAL> - 3.37V

It goes into DFU but a few seconds after 'revive' it reboot.

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.041A
threads.message: Be aware, as already reported on the forum; this board requires good battery, to boot properly!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.041A
threads.message:
With battery connected got 20V 0.04A but after a few seconds drop to 5V 0A (every a few seconds short jump from 0A to 0.024A.

When I connect trackpad and tap on trackpad it switch from 5V to 20V but then the same issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.041A
threads.message:
I suspect SSD problem.
Its voltages come on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.041A
threads.message:
It will make sens about some SSD issue as <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> is liquid damaged.
All resistors around it got correct readings.
<CHIP>U9000</CHIP> replaced and all works fine.
Data safe.

Thank you for help.
